intro: Salicornia herbacea proles annua, commonly known as sea beans or glassworts, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems that store water. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and estuaries, where it thrives in high-salinity conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or red and are borne in clusters. Salicornia herbacea proles annua plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
